revised_title: Effects of Red Bordeaux Wine on Human Physiology
tldr: This study investigates the effects of red Bordeaux wine (claret) on a healthy human subject, focusing on changes in pulse, temperature, and nitrogen, phosphoric acid, chlorine, and free acidity levels in urine. The results show that the wine increased the frequency of the heart's action and caused a slight increase in body weight, but no significant changes were observed in nitrogenous elimination.
